page.title: 03A day at Ditton Junior
page.content: I am Sarah, age 11, and in my last term of Junior School. This is what usually happens on Mondays. The bell rings at 08.55 and we stand still in the playground waiting for our class to be called in by the teacher on duty. Inside we hang up our coats and walk quietly to the classroom. Our teacher takes the register and asks how many people are having school dinner. Most children bring sandwiches. The first lesson is Country Dancing. We love Sword Dancing. In the classroom we have Maths and English. At playtime I play marbles with Susan. She usually wins. After play we carry on with our work. If we get stuck our teacher explains it. In the afternoon we have Rounders unless it rains. People miss Rounders if they have not done their work.
